name: LGBTQ+ Hate Crime Law
description: Hate crime laws protect against crimes caused by hatred towards a protected class. As of October 2009, Congress passed the Matthew Shepard Act, which expanded the definition of hate crimes on the federal level to include gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, and disability for the country. The map below displays state hate crime laws which are not on the federal level.
